data.title: U.S. House Judiciary antitrust report likely to come out as soon as Monday October 5 - source
data.text: The U.S. House of Representatives Judiciary Committee's antitrust subcommittee is expected to release a much anticipated report into antitrust allegations

data.title: U.S. expected to sue Google next week as DOJ seeks support from states
data.text: The U.S. Justice Department is expected to sue Alphabet's Google as soon as next week, and is currently urging state attorneys general to sign onto the lawsuit, according to three sources familiar with the process.

data.title: Report: Google's $2.1 Billion Fitbit Deal Is Close to Approval In Europe
data.text: The tech giant is adding more guarantees of fair competition in an effort to clear regulatory hurdles.

data.title: Ad exec Martin Sorrell says Facebook and Google shouldn't be broken up, boycotts pointless
data.text: Famed advertising executive Martin Sorrell told CNBC that Google and Facebook have been exercising more responsibility and shouldn't be broken up by regulators.

data.title: Tech trade is where the play is now, and for the next three years: Kevin O'Leary
data.text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" team discusses the possibility of a technology rebound and how they are investing in the market ahead of the election.

data.title: These are some of the biggest losers since S&P 500's record high
data.text: Traders Delano Saporu and Nancy Tengler go bargain hunting among the biggest losers as the S&P 500 bounces back from four weeks of losses.

data.title: Better Buy: Netflix vs. Alphabet
data.text: Which FAANG stock will generate bigger returns?

data.title: Google's $310 million sexual harassment settlement aims to set new industry standards
data.text: The company's settlement terms show gaps in the company's structure when it came to sexual harassment and retaliation.

data.title: Google's smaller rivals say it's not playing fair after record EU antitrust fine
data.text: Google's latest Android "choice screen" auction results show Microsoft's Bing was the main winner across most major European markets.

data.title: Google Isn't Giving Up on Fitbit Just Yet
data.text: Alphabet tries one last time to win regulatory approval for its $2.1 billion deal for the struggling wearables pioneer.

data.title: Google offers Europe more checks Fitbit data won’t be used for ads
data.text: Google has offered a second round of concessions to try to persuade European regulators to clear its acquisition of wearables maker Fitbit . The deal has been stalled by concerns over its impact on consumer privacy and competition in the wearables market.

data.title: IDC: Wearables Market to Approach 400 Million Units This Year
data.text: Services combined with hardware will drive demand for wearable gadgets.

data.title: By moving too fast, Bill Barr could damage his Google antitrust case
data.text: AG Barr may win Trump some political points by rushing to file the DOJ’s case against Google. But his haste might hinder the agency’s chance of winning.

data.title: Exclusive: EU concessions include data pledge on Fitbit deal, Google says
data.text: Alphabet unit Google has offered a data pledge similar to a previous offer to EU antitrust regulators investigating its $2.1 billion bid for fitness tracker maker Fitbit , the company confirmed on Tuesday.

data.title: Google Sparks Another EU Antitrust Row Over Skipping Key Search Rivals From Android Choice List
data.text:
Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG) is facing fresh criticism over the way it is allowing its search engine competitors to gain visibility on its Android smartphone operating system in Europe.
 What Happened: On Monday, the company released a list of auction winners that will be ordered randomly in a “choice screen” on Android phones in Europe.
